text:
Using Hubl on a landingspage
using an if with the value of a contact property
     {% if contact.result_1 is defined %}{{ contact.result_1 }} {% else %} … {% endif %} 
in stead of displaying nothing after a submit (value is not known yet)
HubSpot displays value of  domain_settings.merge_tag_defaults.result_1
Where is merge_tag_defaults values coming from? is this a sidewide average or something?
the defaults are set on the properties in the Marketing > Web Pages section (ex: <https://app.HubSpot.com/settings/<your_portal_id>/website/pages/all-domains/page-templates>)
Same deal for emails if you wanted to set defaults for emails (except you’d go to “Marketing > Email”… ex: <https://app.HubSpot.com/settings/<your_portal_id>/marketing/email/configuration> )

Hello,
why related post not show results}

<@UAZCZ3HMW> does the content you’re looking at have topics associated to it? 2nd Question: do any of the expected “Related” posts also have topics that are the same as the topics on the post you’re testing on?
yes, but I do not know what I'm doing wrong

has anyone else been experiencing the issue where you'd put a form embed into a rich_text module, yet it gets stripped out of the content (default content or edited content through the source code of the rich_text)?
have also attempted using the `Insert -> Embed` of the rich_text module to no avail.

Nevermind, found it within the documentation for a rich_text module
```
Please note: To prevent issues where the TinyMCE content editor trims form code scripts, it is necessary to wrap the embedded form code within a div tag.
```
Can we not place a flexible column inside of a custom module that is a repeater?
